result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah J. SILVER

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge, the defendant entered pleas in 15 CM 140.   Motion granted.   
Minutes.
Plea date is reset to 08-18-15 at 1:30 p.m.

Defendant failed to appear for a plea date.
State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.
Minutes

Settlement Conference Summary.
Plea hearing is set for 07-02-15 at 11:00 a.m.
Settlement conference with District Attorney reset for 05-19-15 at 11:00 a.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 04-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 07-02-15 at 11:00 a.m.   Bail is set at $300.00 recognizance bond with the condition that defendant must report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours.  Bail furnished.   
Minutes.

RE:  Bail jumping as repeater, on 01-14-15.
